examples: We should store our toothbrushes upright to allow them to air dry.
Many businesses fail within the first few years because an empty sack cannot stand upright.
The coach reminded his team that an empty sack cannot stand upright, emphasizing the importance of proper nutrition for optimal athletic performance.
Others like gibbons and humans can walk completely upright.
Your immediate ancestors are upright walkers and tool users.
words.defineEn: (of a person) standing or sitting with a straight back
words.defineVi: (của một người) đứng hoặc ngồi thẳng lưng

examples: They had hunched backs, a bit like rhinos or bison.
It's between a hunch and a belief.
We all start out with a hunch, whether we admit it or not.
And it turns out that hunch was right!
As you constantly hunch over a computer or text on your smartphone, you gradually accumulate muscle tension throughout the day.
words.defineEn: to bend the upper side of the body forward and make a rounded back
words.defineVi: uốn cong phần trên của cơ thể về phía trước và làm cho lưng tròn

examples: But he is obviously a rather deft politician, who continues to do and say and tweet things because he believes that that’s a way to convey messages that he wants conveyed to the American people.
words.defineEn: having quick and skillful movements

words.defineEn: slowly and without much energy, sometimes in an attractive way
words.defineVi: chậm rãi và không cần nhiều năng lượng, đôi khi theo một cách hấp dẫn

examples: Iberian caravels were nimble and they could be loaded with cannons.

Georgie is 77 years old and he's nimble as a cat.
words.defineEn: moving fast with ease and agility
words.defineVi: di chuyển nhanh một cách dễ dàng và nhanh nhẹn

examples: Lumbering increased Minty’s physical strength and put her in touch with free black sailors who shipped the wood to the North.
words.defineEn: moving slowly or in an awkward way because of being heavy
words.defineVi: di chuyển chậm hoặc một cách khó xử vì nặng nề

examples: It's like getting a lap dance from a more ungainly Elvis Costello.
And this group of long-necked, dome-headed chalicotheres came to be known by the ungainly name of Shizerotheriinae.
words.defineEn: moving in a way that is awkward and not smooth
words.defineVi: di chuyển một cách vụng về và không suôn sẻ

examples: The rings are no slouch, either.

He's no intellectual slouch.
If I slouch a bit, my feet can easily hit the ground.
And although the Egyptians were the central power in this Bronze Age trade network, the Hittites were no slouches.
words.defineEn: to sit, walk or stand lazily with a downward head and rounded shoulders

examples: He's younger, more lithe, and a little smarter.

words.defineEn: being flexible and moving in an attractive way
words.defineVi: linh hoạt và di chuyển một cách hấp dẫn

examples: It's very supple.

The leather itself should feel very supple, very luxurious.
What is-- It was so soft and supple.
words.defineEn: flexible and able to move smoothly and gracefully; not stiff
words.defineVi: uyển chuyển và có thể di chuyển uyển chuyển, duyên dáng; không cứng

examples: A teepee was erected.

Monopolies are able to erect obstacles that economists call barriers to entry.
In 1999, London, England, continued the tradition of marking momentous occasions by erecting a Ferris wheel.
words.defineEn: straight, with an upright position
words.defineVi: thẳng, với một vị trí thẳng đứng

examples: Louisa was a pretty girl of about fifteen, with the same sullen look as her brother.
She gives him endless love and kindness, and he pays her back with his sullen, selfish, and ungrateful ways.
'Ah, so this sullen young thing is all she cares for,' thought James Harthouse.
He had begun to think that he'd like it if the pretty but impassive face, which changed so beautifully for the sullen young brother, could change for him, too.
words.defineEn: bad-tempered and gloomy, and usually silent
words.defineVi: xấu tính và ảm đạm, và thường im lặng

examples: The actor's grimace of pain was so convincing that the audience winced in sympathy.

The only time in my listening experience that I was kinda disappointed was someone was playing a really high-pitched harmonica and that just super high wheezing kind of made me wince.
words.defineEn: to show a facial expression that signifies shame or pain
words.defineVi: để hiển thị một nét mặt biểu thị sự xấu hổ hoặc đau đớn

examples: Trade school as post-secondary education can be a ticket to a six-figure income, but it's sneered at by kids, parents and teachers alike.

words.defineEn: to smile or speak in a way that suggests mockery or disrespect toward someone
words.defineVi: cười hoặc nói theo cách gợi ý chế giễu hoặc thiếu tôn trọng đối với ai đó

Little beams of light played over the sea.
Beam of light knocks him down.
words.defineEn: to smile joyfully in an obvious way
words.defineVi: cười vui vẻ một cách rõ ràng

examples: Maybe the subject is squinting or they‘re wearing a hat or a scarf.

eyesight, you don't wanna have to squint at it and be like, "Okay, what does this say?"

words.defineEn: to look with eyes half-opened when hit by light, or as a sign of suspicion, etc.

examples: And more moderate Enlightenment thinkers were also more willing to countenance hierarchical social and political structures.
words.defineEn: someone's face or facial expression
words.defineVi: khuôn mặt hoặc nét mặt của ai đó

examples: Emily always ensures she gets her beauty sleep to maintain her radiant complexion.
Emily's glowing complexion, radiant smile, and boundless energy make her the picture of good health.

words.defineEn: the natural color and appearance of someone's skin, especially the face
words.defineVi: màu sắc tự nhiên và sự xuất hiện của làn da của một ai đó, đặc biệt là khuôn mặt

examples: She grimaced at the taste of the bitter medicine.

words.defineEn: to twist our face in an ugly way because of pain, strong dislike, etc., or when trying to be funny

examples: That should wipe the grin off his face.

Charles was sitting in his place, grinning like a Cheshire cat, when I joined him.
words.defineEn: to smile widely in a way that displays the teeth
words.defineVi: để cười rộng rãi trong một cách hiển thị các răng

examples: Wipe that smirk off your face, you little punk.

I think what was that smirk all about?
What do you keep smirking for?
words.defineEn: to smile in a silly and unpleasant way, indicating a high opinion of oneself
words.defineVi: cười một cách ngớ ngẩn và khó chịu, thể hiện ý kiến cao về bản thân

examples: Spare his blushes.

words.defineEn: to become red in the face, especially as a result of embarrassment, shyness, or shame

words.defineVi: để nhìn hoặc nhìn chằm chằm vào một ai đó giận dữ

examples: The stout and the espresso powder add so much depth to this cake.

words.defineEn: (of a person) slightly fat and heavy

words.defineEn: (of a woman) small in an attractive way

words.defineEn: having a short but quite solid figure, especially a man

words.defineEn: sexually attractive and very seductive

Those white spots are called callosities because, well, they’re basically calluses.
